items.title: Stuff We Liked: Mapping Slang’s Spread, Suburban Demographics
items.abstract: Other interesting reads from here and there included a deeper look at Civil War soldiers and a map of where Britons swear most.

items.title: Exploring New York, on Foot and With Maps
items.abstract: William B. Helmreich offers “The Brooklyn Nobody Knows: An Urban Walking Guide,” and Katharine Harmon has essays, maps and illustrations in “You Are Here: N.Y.C., Mapping the Soul of the City.”

items.title: 19 Countries, 43 States, 327 Cities: Mapping The Times’s Election Coverage
items.abstract: New York Times political reporters filed some 2.98 million words during the 2016 election. We tracked their stops.

items.title: Mapping Out Where Noir Lives in the City of Angels
items.abstract: Los Angeles has long been the perfect backdrop from crime writers. This map of the city will help you find the setting for nine books, classic and new.

items.title: Student Crossword | Geography of the Middle East
items.abstract: Learn more about the geography of the Middle East by playing our crossword, either online or in print.
